metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8602 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
iterator.c in NLnet Labs Unbound before 1.5.1 does not limit delegation chaining, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory and CPU consumption) via a large or infinite number of referrals.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunbound2 - 1.4.22-1ubuntu5
python-unbound - 1.4.22-1ubuntu5
unbound - 1.4.22-1ubuntu5
unbound-anchor - 1.4.22-1ubuntu5
unbound-host - 1.4.22-1ubuntu5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: unbound package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.22-1ubuntu5').
